availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1859-1862

body.p:
Henderson June 9th 1862
Hon G Green
Frankfort Ky
My Dear Sir

At the September session of the Legislature an act was passed & became a law chartering a Female College in our City (Henderson) no copy of the act has reached here, Professor Parsons scholastic year is about to expire & he desires to graduate some of the young Ladies under his tutelage in accordance with the provisions of the charter referred to
Will you be so kind as to forward me by Return Mail with a coppy of the act? if not printed please forward a copy from the manuscrip on file & I will pay for the charges for coppying
P S Young ladis Candidates for diplomas are anxious about the matter
